required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Study on Predicting Response of Recurrent Glioblastoma to Apatinib

brief_summary.textblock: Anti-angiogenic therapy is an important treatment strategy for recurrent glioblastoma. Our previous study provided evidence for a potential benefit of apatinib, a humanized monoclonal antibody against VEGFR-2, when added to temozolomide chemotherapy in patients with recurrent glioblastoma. Some patients showed durable responses and prolonged survival, with recorded survival times of over 30 months in 6.4% patients. However, a subset of patients progressed in 2 months. There is a strong need to better predict and monitor apatinib treatment response to prevent patients from adverse effects of ineffective therapy. In this study, whole genome sequencing and RNA-sequencing of formalin-fixed, paraffin-embedded tumor materials from the participants who received apatinib and temozolomide treatment will be performed to identify the response biomarkers and patients who may benefit most from apatinib, avoiding unnecessary potential toxicity and cost for those who are unlikely to benefit from the drug.

arm_group.description: After treatment, tumor achieved complete response or partial response and the progression-free survival time was ≥6 months.
After treatment, tumor remains stable and the progression-free survival time was more than 1 month and less than 6 months.
After treatment, tumor got progressed and the progression-free survival time was no more than 1 month.

intervention.description: the underlying genetic characteristics that prodicting response

study_pop.textblock: Neuro-oncology Department, Sanbo Bran Hospital Capital Medical University

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Age 18-70 years old
2. recurrent glioblastoma
3. received apatinib plus temozolomide treatment，response and survival data were available
4. tumor tissues were acquired
Exclusion Criteria:
-

facility.name: Capital Medical University Sanbo Brain Hospital
